description.narrative:
Oxfam Uganda in consortium with other partners intends to focus on improving the situation of learners which is an essential precondition to strengthen the whole education system, including teachers and educators. In the context of refugee settlementsin Uganda and South Sudan it will be necessary to work with the informal education structures as the formal system is in ruins, non-existent or completely overstretched to meet the needs.
To achieve this the Oxfam-led consortium has identified the needto work with a holistic and integrated approach that works with learners, teachers, educators and education systems as well as civil society at all levels. The outcomes and intermediary outcomes focuses on target groups and will be presented as such below. Subsequently the interlinkages and cross-cutting approaches will be explained.
Outcome 1: Improved resilience of learners and teachers in targeted areas in South Sudan and Uganda Learners in the target areas will improve their situation in the following way (FIGURES): - Increased enrolment rate - Increased promotion rate - Decreased drop-out rate - Learners feel better prepared to withstand shocks, stresses and uncertainties Teachers (FIGURE) in the target areas will improve their situation inthe following way: - Teachers feel better prepared to withstand shocks, stresses and uncertainties

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security
